result.execSummary:
The defendant Jovan T Mull was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $175.00 to Elaine C., $300.00 payable to Dreacy A.

Pay Court costs, all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA sample and restitution.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Elaine C. and Dreacy A., Vachune H. and Claire B.
No alcohol or illegal drugs.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of Extended Supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovan T Mull in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Jovan T Mull in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 13 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 8 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, consecutive to 15CF2419, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $175.00 payable to Elaine C., $300 payable to Dreacy A. to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-No contact with Elaine C. and Dreacy A. , Vachune H. and Claire B.  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Jovan T Mull in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Jovan T Mull in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled.

As to Count 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

As to Counts 1 & 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 1 & 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
